svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
November 6, 2016" date: "2016-11-06"
News and Links
Top
* Hard Fork 2 timing hasn’t been officially announced yet , but Gavin Wood says it is
likely to be block 2,642,462 . That is, in Two Weeks. HF2 may include EIP 170 for a
code size limit. How developers reach protocol consensus in Ethereum . The Foundation
won’t become the “formal governance body” for the protocol
Hard Fork 2 timing hasn’t been officially announced yet , but Gavin Wood says it is
likely to be block 2,642,462 . That is, in Two Weeks.
* HF2 may include EIP 170 for a code size limit.
HF2 may include EIP 170 for a code size limit.
* How developers reach protocol consensus in Ethereum .
How developers reach protocol consensus in Ethereum .
* The Foundation won’t become the “formal governance body” for the protocol
The Foundation won’t become the “formal governance body” for the protocol
* Another 15 or so Devcon2 videos have been released. Consensys releases BHP Billiton -
Tyler Smith and a bunch of other International BlockChain Week videos . I’m
particularly interested in Virtue Poker .
Another 15 or so Devcon2 videos have been released.
* Consensys releases BHP Billiton - Tyler Smith and a bunch of other International
BlockChain Week videos . I’m particularly interested in Virtue Poker .
* Solidity Security Alert: variables can be overwritten in storage . Christian
Reitwiessner : “this bug is so hard to exploit although it looks quite serious on the
first glance.”
Solidity Security Alert: variables can be overwritten in storage .
* Christian Reitwiessner : “this bug is so hard to exploit although it looks quite
serious on the first glance.”
Tech
* Hardware Signing for Ethereum ?
Hardware Signing for Ethereum ?
* VB : “One of the important indicators of how much load the Ethereum blockchain can
safely handle is how the uncle rate responds to the gas usage of a transaction”
VB : “One of the important indicators of how much load the Ethereum blockchain can
* Lefteris Karapetsas on Raiden and Yoichi Hirai on Smart Contract Formal Verification
at Berlin Meetup.
Lefteris Karapetsas on Raiden and Yoichi Hirai on Smart Contract Formal Verification
* Smart Contracts in Java - video of David Roon talk. web3j lightweight Ethereum
library for Java applications v1.0 release
Smart Contracts in Java - video of David Roon talk.
* web3j lightweight Ethereum library for Java applications v1.0 release
* Browser-Solidity IDE
Browser-Solidity IDE
* “ All accounts are contracts ” proposal for Metropolis release.
“ All accounts are contracts ” proposal for Metropolis release.
* Avsa’s multi-sig variation: “ any single account can schedule a delayed transaction,
but more signatures make the delay smaller ”
Avsa’s multi-sig variation: “ any single account can schedule a delayed transaction,
* Call for papers on trusted smart contracts .
Call for papers on trusted smart contracts .
* Video of Vitalik dev talk at Taipei Meetup . The audience got some high praise . Tips
for a new Eth dev
Video of Vitalik dev talk at Taipei Meetup . The audience got some high praise .
* Tips for a new Eth dev
Ecosystem
* Alex Felix on Investment in Blockchain Cryptoassets . Unsubtle hint: it’s a
profitable read.
Alex Felix on Investment in Blockchain Cryptoassets . Unsubtle hint: it’s a profitable
read.
* Fred Ehrsam developed his Meetup talk into a Coinbase blog post: How to Raise Money
on a Blockchain with a Token
Fred Ehrsam developed his Meetup talk into a Coinbase blog post: How to Raise Money on
a Blockchain with a Token
* Faster Event Resolution in Augur Augur wants to hire an amazing trading UI dev
Faster Event Resolution in Augur
* Augur wants to hire an amazing trading UI dev
* Ethereum USA conference tickets on sale. Refundable for any reason until Feb 2017.
Ethereum USA conference tickets on sale. Refundable for any reason until Feb 2017.
* AuctionHouse: dapp for auctioning on-chain goods.
AuctionHouse: dapp for auctioning on-chain goods.
Token Sales
* Gnosis publishes its code . Bug bounty program starts. This means the ICO is less
than 30 days away now – it will be a Dutch auction .
* Golem ICO begins 11/11
* Understanding the Technology Behind the iEx.ec Distributed Cloud
* Daniel Zakrisson doesn’t hold back in his Crowdsale Analyses, like this one on
Inchain .
* The payday loan industry and how Branche plans to change it . It will be interesting
to see how much Branche raises, given my estimation how few people in the ETH community
understand payday loans.
* Beyond the Void hit their ICO cap in 12 mins.
General Blockchain / non-Ethereum
* Jutta Steiner doesn’t do many interviews, but she did a 20 min podcast on how
Ethereum can remake society.
* SEC press release on Nov 14 Fintech/Blockchain forum .
* South African Reserve Bank sets up a test blockchain for its banks.
* Microsoft’s Project Bletchley, now called Ethereum Consortium Blockchain Network –
start a private chain with one click.
Dates of note
* Nov 11 – Golem crowdsale begins [not yet officially announced]
* Nov 14 – SEC has a fintech/blockchain meeting
* Nov 15 – vDice crowdsale begins
* Dec 1 - approximate (not yet announced) beginning of Gnosis crowdsale
* Dec 7 – Inchain crowdsale ends
* Dec 15 – vDice crowdsale ends
[I aim for a relatively comprehensive list of Ethereum sales, but make no warranty as
to even whether they are legit; as such, I thus likewise warrant nothing about whether
any will produce a satisfactory return. This is not investment advice; I charge heavily
for that.]
If you liked this, help it continue by sharing.
If you’d like to send me Ether to keep me motivated to do these roundups, then I’d like
to make that easy for you:
0x96d4F0E75ae86e4c46cD8e9D4AE2F2309bD6Ec45
Week in Ethereum News
